name: The Vandals: Limited Edition Silk Screened 2014 Christmas Formal Poster (AUTOGRAPHED)
description: Limited to 100, original Silk-screened official poster for the event signed and numbered by artist Lou XRay and autographed by the band. And by the band we mean Dave, Warren, Joe, & Josh.

name: The Show Must Go Off!: The Adolescents Live at House of Blues CD & DVD
description:
Many bands can use the phrase "legendary Orange County punk band" in their bio, but only a very select few can still show why they carry that title. The Adolescents easily prove it in the latest episode of our CD/DVD series "The Show Must Go Off!!" 

While they may not jump in unison or have carefully-placed tattoos, and they may have been around long enough for VH1's "Remember The 80's," this is no reunion fluke or a last-chance grab for the novelty cash. Quality endures over time better than the pre-fab mall punk of today, proving The Adolescents are still relevant and are around for very good reason.

name: THE VANDALS: Machine Gun Hoodie
description:
Based off THE VANDALS machine gun logo, the classic machine gun V is on the front with THE VANDALS spelled out on the lower back. Zip-up, super comfortable black hoodie. Basically the only hoodie you will ever need. It's that awesome.

Available in Adult Medium, Large, X-Large, and XX-Large!

name: The Vandals: The Paul Williams Tee
description:
In 1973, Paul Williams starred as Virgil, the wise Orangutan in THE BATTLE FOR THE PLANET OF THE APES. In 2013, The Vandals had him put on a T-shirt to remind us all of the most important Ape law. "Ape Shall Not Kill Ape."  Which if you think about it, is just good manners. 

Drawn by Dominic Davi, the "Paul Williams" Tee debuted at The Vandals show on October, 19th 2013, which by all accounts was a very good show.

name: The Vandals: Shingo Japanese Remix Album
description:
Remixer and Panda, No Panda member Shingo Asari tackles 11 selections from the Vandals' recent catalog on this awesome remix album. 

Track listing: 

1. How They Getcha
2. 4.3.2.1.0.-1
3. Appreciate My Honesty
4. Be A Good Robot
5. Disproportioned Head
6. Little Weirdo
7. When I Say You, I Mean Me
8. The Unseen Tears Of The Albacore
9. I'm Becoming You
10. My Neck, My Back
11. Lord Of The Dance

name: The Vandals: "Hollywood Potato Chip" CD
description:
In the midst of all their other contributions to society (like running a successful independent record label, writing hit songs for a hit movie, performing with other BIGGER bands and musicians, and selling booze to the demanding public), four So-Cal guys decided it was time to release another album. Thankfully, those four guys happen to be established punk legends. 

Ladies and gentlemen, Kung Fu Records is proud to present Hollywood Potato Chip. By bringing in a few heavy-hitters to the cause, namely Jerry Finn (AFI, Blink-182, Alkaline Trio and 100 others) who mixed the album, makes Hollywood Potato Chip an exceptional album among a history of exceptional albums. Keeping in the tradition of fast-tempo melodies and numerous inside jokes, The Vandals remain one of the last bastions of punk rock that can be fun without compromising musicality and performance ability. As an ode to the shady industry in which many people strive to be a part of, The Vandals have created an album that pays tribute to the darker side of Hollywood, where naive and starry-eyed transplants are put through the twisted ringer of head shots and casting calls, and once the energetic drive is over, all that is left behind are remnants of a once-powerful Producer and a filthy couch on the sidewalk.

Where were we? Oh yeah....it's awesome! 

Track listing: 

1. This Is My Special Moment			
2. Good Robot			
3. My Neck, My Back, My Neack and My Back			
4. That Guy			
5. Don't Say Impossible			
6. I'm Just a Man			
7. Blame the People			
8. Designed by Satan			
9. How They Getcha'			
10. Don't Stop Me Now See All 2			
11. I Guess I'll Take You Back			
12. I Am Crushed			
13. Atrocity

name: The Vandals: "Internet Dating Superstuds" CD
description:
The Vandals have stuck to their guns as the wackiest of all the prank-punk bands around with "Internet Dating Superstuds".  Fast paced, catchy, and fun...The Vandals shine on this amazing album. 


Track listing: 

1. 43210-1
2. Appreciate/My Honesty
3. I'm Becoming You
4. Disproportioned Head
5. Soccer Mom
6. We'll All Get Laid
7. Little Weirdo
8. I Can't Wait
9. Where's Your Dignity?
10. My Brain Tells My Body
11. When I Say You I Mean Me
12. The Unseen Tears Of The Albacore
13. My Brother Is Gay
14. Lord Of The Dance

name: The Vandals: " Play Really Bad Original Country Tunes" CD
description:
Interpunk says it best: 

"If ever there was a record that could be called "long awaited," this is it. Ten fucked-up songs recorded in secret by one of America's most fucked-up bands. Released only because the kids found out they existed, and wouldn't stop writing annoying letters to the label asking for a free tape. Includes such worthless opuses as "Goop All Over The Phone (Pleasant All Over The Bill)," and "Play That Country Tuba Cowboy." Not since "Anarchy Burger" has a group touched our hearts so."

Pretty much dead on! 

Track listing: 

1. Clowns Are Experts (At Making Us Laugh)
2. Susanville	
3. Desert Woman	
4. In America		
5.  Elvis Decanter	
6. Goop All Over The Phone (And Pleasant All Over The Bill)
7. Gator Hid	
8. Long Hair Queen
9. Play That Country Tuba, Cowboy	
10.  Complain (From the Film Bob Roberts)

name: The Vandals: "Fear Of A Punk Planet" CD
description:
Fear of a Punk Planet is possibly the definitive Vandals release. There are the covers of corny pop songs played at maximum velocity and with sneering, snotty vocals. There are the supremely silly lyrics. There are the amped-up, speedy songs.  All played with amazing skill.  We love it and we think you will too. 

Track Listing: 
1. Pizza Tran	
2. The Rodge
3. Join Us for Pong
4. Hey Holmes!
5. Girls Turn 18 Every Day
6. Kill My Tenant
7. Summer Lovin'
8. The Day Farrah Fawcett Died
9. Anti	
10. Teenage Idol
11. Small Wonder	
12. Phone Machine
13. Shi'ite Punk
14. China Town
15. Working for the Man
16. Kokomo

name: The Vandals: "Oi to the World" CD
description:
This record has been hailed as the best Vandals record ever.

Finally reissued with new cover art, as well as a bonus track: a fully orchestrated overture arranged by Warren "Mutant Boy" Fitzgerald and performed by the Mullet California Symphony Orchestra.

Track listing: 

1	 A Gun For Christmas
2	 Grandpa's Last Christmas
3	 Thanx For Nothing	
4	 Oi To The World
5	 Nothing's Gonna Ruin My Holiday
6	 Christmas For My Penis		
7	 I Don't Believe In Santa Clause	
8	 My First Xmas, As A Woman	
9	 Dance Of The Sugarplum Fairies	
10	 Here I Am Lord		
11	 C-H-R-I-S-T-M-A-S		
12	 Hang Myself From The Tree
13	 Overture

name: The Vandals: "When In Rome Do As The Vandals Do" CD
description:
Interpunk may have said it best:

"This is the miraculous follow up to the classic EP Peace Thru Vandalism. We call it miraculous because after achieving the impossible by making their first EP on Epitaph Records into a radio smash, they defied all odds by doing the exact same thing, but even bigger, on their second try with Lady Killer climbing to the top of the alternative radio charts and actually finishing higher than songs like Billy Idol’s Rebel Yell on KROQ’s top 106 songs for 1984. Before there was the Beastie Boys’ Licensed To Ill, before there was NWA, there was Lady Killer and the Vandals pathetically constructed home console turntable (w/ 8-track) worn by the lead singer with a guitar strap. It was called the “scratch-box” and it was all-wrong but the Vandals didn’t know and didn’t care. That was their brand of punk rock from the O.C"

Now digitally Re-Mastered by Michael Hateley, this punk rock classic sounds better then ever, and is on vinyl as it was originally intended to be!

Track Listing: 
1.	"Ladykiller" 
2.	"Birthday Bash" 
3.	"Master Race (In Outer Space)" 
4.	"Big Bro vs. Johnny Sako" 
5.	"Mohawk Town" 
6.	"Viking Suit" 
7.	"Hocus Pocus" (written and originally performed by Focus)	
8.	"I'm a Fly" 
9.	"Slap of Love" 
10.	"Airstream" 
11.	"Rico"

name: The Vandals: "Peace Through Vandalism" CD
description:
As poster boys of the original Huntington Beach punk rock scene in the very early 80s, The Vandals debut release provided the soundtrack for an era of mayhem and mindless rebellion for tens of thousands of bored teenagers from the suburbs to the hood. If you were punk rock in the 80s, this was your music. It started with Urban Struggle going from Rodney Bingenheimer’s Top 10, to #1 on KROQ’s mainstream play list in L.A. When the Vandals performed “The Legend Of Pat Brown” in the Roger Corman / Penelope Spheeris 1983 classic film “Suburbia” the EP became a must have for punks all over the world.

Peace Thru Vandalism is also a "must re-have" part of any collection that claims to have any punk rock in it.

Now digitally Re-Mastered by Michael Hateley, this punk rock classic sounds better then ever, and is on vinyl as it was originally intended to be!

Track Listing:

Wanna Be Manor 
Urban Struggle 
The Legend of Pat Brown 
Pirate's Life 
Anarchy Burger (Hold the Government)

name: The Vandals: Limited Edition Silk Screened 2014 Halloween Show Poster (AUTOGRAPHED)
description:
Kick off Halloween with The Vandals, TSOL, The Dickies, and Duane Peters on October 19th at the L.A. Fearplex in Pomona, CA!

This silk screened poster is limited to 200 copies only! 
Delivered in reinforced mailing tube.

A limited number will be signed by The Vandals. Please specify below if you want your poster autographed!

name: The Show Must Go Off!: The Vandals Live at House of Blues
description:
8 camera broadcast quality video and 24 tracks of sound make this Orange County home town performance of 22 songs by the Vandals a must have. They will never be younger or better looking than they were on this night!

Then the Vandals give you more: Witness the Josh Freese-Cam!. At any time during the viewing of this DVD, you can push one button on your remote to instantly see what Josh is doing at that moment, complete with a "picture in a picture" close-up of his foot pedal action. How does he do it? Here are many of the answers.  Is this a concert film or a drum clinic? One has to ask. 

The DVD also comes with a free Audio disc of the entire performance for you car or personalized listening device. 

Do you like the Vandals' lyrics? One button can put every word spoken or sung that night right on the screen at any stage of the concert (bouncing ball not included). Don't get the jokes? Study them. Learn Engrish!

There are also plenty of the kind of Easter eggs, trailers, videos, previews that make any episode of Kung Fu's "The Show Must Go Off" super special; 88 minutes of total material!

name: The Vandals: Kung Fu Records Hoodie
description:
One day The Vandals and Kung Fu Records came together as one and made this amazing hoodie. The people rejoiced and there was much merry making in the streets of the world. 

Now we are making it available online for you to own. Available in Youth Medium and Youth Large.

name: The Vandals: White Machine Gun Black Tee
description: It doesn't get much more straight forward then this. The classic Vandals logo printed in distressed white on a black tee. This is probably the most punk rock T-shirt we have for sale, which means it might be the coolest.

name: The Vandals: Green Machine Gun Black Tee
description:
The original logo....on a shirt. It's awesome. 

Let's be honest, you should already own this...and only be ordering it because your old one wore out.  Oh, this is your first one? It's ok...no worries...this is your chance to make it right and get awesome.  We are here to help! 

We're Kung Fu Records...and Punk Rock is your Friend!

name: The Vandals: Limited Edition Silk Screened 3-D Poster (AUTOGRAPHED) w/glasses!
description:
From a Canadian show early this century or late last by artist Adam Swinbourne. It's 3D, silkscreened, and comes with glasses.  How awesome is that?  All signed and numbered by artist.
10 are signed by all 4 members of The Vandals.  $30.00

name: The Vandals: "When In Rome, Do As The Vandals" Vinyl LP
description:
Interpunk may have said it best: 

"This is the miraculous follow up to the classic EP Peace Thru Vandalism. We call it miraculous because after achieving the impossible by making their first EP on Epitaph Records into a radio smash, they defied all odds by doing the exact same thing, but even bigger, on their second try with Lady Killer climbing to the top of the alternative radio charts and actually finishing higher than songs like Billy Idol’s Rebel Yell on KROQ’s top 106 songs for 1984. Before there was the Beastie Boys’ Licensed To Ill, before there was NWA, there was Lady Killer and the Vandals pathetically constructed home console turntable (w/ 8-track) worn by the lead singer with a guitar strap. It was called the “scratch-box” and it was all-wrong but the Vandals didn’t know and didn’t care. That was their brand of punk rock from the O.C"

Now digitally Re-Mastered by Michael Hateley, this punk rock classic sounds better then ever, and is on vinyl as it was originally intended to be!

Track Listing:
1.	"Ladykiller"  	 
2.	"Birthday Bash"  	 
3.	"Master Race (In Outer Space)"  	 
4.	"Big Bro vs. Johnny Sako"  	 
5.	"Mohawk Town"  	 
6.	"Viking Suit"  	 
7.	"Hocus Pocus" (written and originally performed by Focus)	 
8.	"I'm a Fly"  	 
9.	"Slap of Love"  	 
10.	"Airstream"  	 
11.	"Rico"

name: The Vandals: "Peace Thru Vandalism" Picture Disc Vinyl LP
description:
As poster boys of the original Huntington Beach punk rock scene in the very early 80s, The Vandals debut release provided the soundtrack for an era of mayhem and mindless rebellion for tens of thousands of bored teenagers from the suburbs to the hood. If you were punk rock in the 80s, this was your music. It started with Urban Struggle going from Rodney Bingenheimer’s Top 10, to #1 on KROQ’s mainstream play list in L.A. When the Vandals performed “The Legend Of Pat Brown” in the Roger Corman / Penelope Spheeris 1983 classic film “Suburbia” the EP became a must have for punks all over the world. 

Peace Thru Vandalism is also a "must re-have" part of any collection that claims to have any punk rock in it.  

Now digitally Re-Mastered by Michael Hateley, this punk rock classic sounds better then ever, and is on a picture disc vinyl.

Track Listing:

Wanna Be Manor
Urban Struggle
The Legend of Pat Brown
Pirate's Life
Anarchy Burger (Hold the Government)

name: The Vandals: "Peace Thru Vandalism" Vinyl LP
description:
This EP was recorded at Unicorn studios in Santa Monica in 1982. It was the first non Bad Religion release for Epitaph Records. The band at the time were proteges of TSOL. When the EP was released, the song Urban Struggle quickly achieved high rotation on KROQ in Los Angeles and a few other stations around the country, which was really unusual for a sloppy punk band from Huntington Beach. 

Credit goes to Jay Bentley of Bad Religion for discovering the band and signing them to Epitaph which at the time was owned by all members of B.R

Now digitally Re-Mastered by Michael Hateley, this punk rock classic sounds better then ever, and is on vinyl as it was originally intended to be!

Track Listing:

Wanna Be Manor
Urban Struggle
The Legend of Pat Brown
Pirate's Life
Anarchy Burger (Hold the Government)

name: Kung Fu Records: How Long BLUE Tee
description:
How Long is the Kung Fu Records mascot.  No really. He is. How Long is the Kung Fu mascot. There are so many legends about his adventures. He has walked this world and now he can be on your shirt. Telling the world...chill out. It's gonna be ok. I know Kung Fu.  I got this.

How Long is a cool mofo.

HOW LONG IS ONLY AVAILABLE ON A BLUE TEE

name: The Vandals: Joke of a Skull BLACK Tee
description:
ONLY SOLD AT THE LIVE PERFORMANCES.....UNTIL NOW!!!

If you are too lazy to go to one of the shows, or maybe you live too far away and will never get to one, this is your first chance to get one delivered to your home by postal mutants.

The Vandals: Joke of a Skull was designed by artist Dominic Davi, whom took it as a challenge when we said The Vandals could never pull off a shirt with a skull on it.

name: Judge GREY Tee by Shepard Fairey
description:
2012 was the year Joe Escalante (bassist for The Vandals and one of the founders of Kung Fu Records) ran to become a judge of Los Angeles County. Sadly, the man won and a L.A. does not have a punk rocker on the bench...but we do have this sweet Grey Judge T-shirt

Designed by artist Shepard Fairey who like many of us, dreamed of a world where a punk rocker could be a judge in Los Angeles.

name: Blink 182: Buddha Vinyl LP
description:
Buddha album by Blink 182 was re-released Oct 27, 1998 on the Kung Fu label. Consisting of demos, Blink-182's first album, Buddha, is a solid skate-punk record that illustrates the group's flair for speedy, catchy hooks and irreverent humor. 

There is not much to say here about Blink 182 that you probably don't already know. This is a re-issue of their limited debut long form digitally re-mixed and re-mastered. this is a rare snapshot of the Blink's innocent beginnings in San Diego, California and is now their only independently distributed album in existence. 

All tracks have been digitally remastered. 

Recorded at Double Time Studios, San Diego, California in 1995.

Track Listing: 

Carousel 
T.V. 
Strings
Fentoozler 
Time 
Romeo And Rebecca 
21 Days 
Sometimes 
Point Of View 
My Pet Sally 
Reebok Commercial 
Toast & Bananas 
The Girl Next Door 
Don't

name: Blink 182: Buddha CD
description:
Buddha album by Blink 182 was re-released Oct 27, 1998 on the Kung Fu label. Consisting of demos, Blink-182's first album, Buddha, is a solid skate-punk record that illustrates the group's flair for speedy, catchy hooks and irreverent humor. 

There is not much to say here about Blink 182 that you probably don't already know. This is a re-issue of their limited debut long form digitally re-mixed and re-mastered. this is a rare snapshot of the Blink's innocent beginnings in San Diego, California and is now their only independently distributed album in existence. 

All tracks have been digitally remastered. 

Recorded at Double Time Studios, San Diego, California in 1995.

Track Listing: 

Carousel 
T.V. 
Strings
Fentoozler 
Time 
Romeo And Rebecca 
21 Days 
Sometimes 
Point Of View 
My Pet Sally

Toast & Bananas 
The Girl Next Door 
Don't

name: The Ataris: "Blue Skies, Broken Hearts....Next 12 Exits" CD
description:
The Ataris story reads like a punk-rock fairy tale: teenager lives in boring mid-western town (Anderson, Indiana); goes to a Vandals show and gives the band a tape; weeks later gets a call from Vandals bassist and owner of Kung Fu Records Joe Escalante asking him to record for his label; moves to California and puts band together  with LAGWAGON's drummer DEREK PLOURDE; gets invited to tour with some of his favorite bands. 
The saga continues with "Blue Skies, Broken Hearts...Next 12 Exits", for Kung Fu Records, which has sold an average of over 600 copies per week worldwide since its April 1999 release, and still growing.
Find out why this album is still as amazing today as it was the day it was released...

options.name: The Ataris: "Blue Skies, Broken Hearts...Next 12 Exits" CD

name: The Vandals: "Sweating To The Oldies" LIVE CONCERT DVD
description:
Directed by Jeff Stein (The Kids are Alright), with 5 cameras and a 16 track analog soundtrack, this is a documentation of a classic Vandals Orange County performance is one of the seminal punk concert videos. The video is laced through out with hilarious personal profiles of The Vandals within chaotic yet tight live stage performances. 

Special DVD features include interactive menus, never before seen out-take footage, commentary audio track from the band members themselves, closed captions, bonus videos and trailers.


Director: Jeff Stein
Format: Closed-captioned, Color, NTSC
Region: All Regions
Aspect Ratio: 1.33:1
Number of discs: 1
Rated: NR (Not Rated)
Run Time: 60 minutes

name: "FEAR OF A PUNK PLANET Vol. 1" DVD Collection
description:
"Fear of a Punk Planet" is the first-ever original scripted series in a television format depicting life in the Southern California punk rock scene. Fear of a Punk Planet video Volume 1 features 3 episodes led off NOFX and 7 extra concert performances from BOuncing Souls, Sick Of It All, Ataris and Good Riddance. Nothing like this ever happened before, and nothing like it will ever happen again, so get yours now!

A unique and entertaining combination of music video and dramedy, FEAR OF A PUNK PLANET stars comedic talents Kyle Gass (of Tenacious D) and Scott Aukerman (of HBO's cult series MR. SHOW) while featuring raucous music performances from NOFX, the Mr. T Experience, the Ataris and others. In the first of 2 stories, Kyle Gass plays a stuffy fire marshall who shuts down a local punk rock nightclub. Though very different in their views about punk rock, 4 punks band together to save the club.

Format: Color, NTSC
Language: English
Region: All Regions
Aspect Ratio: 1.33:1
Number of discs: 1

name: "CAKE BOY" DVD A Full Length Feature Comedy By Joe Escalante
description:
Warren Fitzgerald (guitarist for The Vandals) is the writer and star of this eccentric film (directed by Joe Escalante) about punk rock, road trips, handicapped lovers, and erotic baked goods. Selwyn Hills (Fitzgerald) is a down-and-out guy with a special gift for baking cakes in the shapes of female body parts. While his skills are evident to anyone who's seen his creations, Selwyn doesn't get much credit around town. In fact, everyone picks on him-- especially his abusive girlfriend. When circumstances require Selwyn to skip town, he joins the punk band No Use For A Name and embarks on a journey of roadie hell. Working for the band is barely an improvement over the life he left behind, but things start looking up when Selwyn meets an attractive young woman in a wheel chair. This new relationship and his experience on the road give Selwyn the confidence to enter the ultimate baking competition in which he competes against a masterful French baker. 

Escalante approached making this film from a do-it-yourself standpoint, shooting on 16mm and 35mm film on nights and weekends without a crew. He went on to edit the film himself, completing the entire project for under $30,000. 

CAKE BOY (formerly entitled SELWYN'S NUTS) includes a  separate CD punk rock soundtrack and a cameo by Bob Odenkirk of MR. SHOW. Featured bands include No Use For A Name, The Vandals, Ozma, Hunter Revenge, Jackson, Audio Karate, Useless ID, and Piebald.

Written by Warren Fitzgerald 
Directed by Joe Escalante  

DVD Features:
Number of Discs: 2
Rated: Unrated
Run Time: 1 hours, 30 minutes
Video: Color
Encoding: Region 0 (Worldwide)
Originally Released: 2005
Label: Kung Fu Records
Aspect Ratio: Full Frame - 1.33
Audio:English
Subtitles - English - Optional
Subtitles - Japanese - Optional

Additional Release Material:
Deleted Scenes
Audio Commentary: Joe Escalante and Warren Fitzgerald - Director, Star/Writer
Featurette: MAKING OF CAKE BOY
Music Video: THIS AIN'T NO WAY TO LIVE

name: "THAT DARN PUNK" DVD A Feature Film by Jeff Richardson
description:
That Darn Punk is the first feature from the film production leg of Kung-Fu Records. Escalante himself stars as Dirk Castigo, a down-on-his-luck punk rock bass player, who's been kicked out by his girlfriend (Mia Crowe) with nothing but a pair of boxer shorts. As if that weren't bad enough, throughout the film Dirk faces everyone from kidnappers to aliens from outer space.

Released straight to video in 2001 and featuring an appearance by Kyle Gass of Tenacious D, That Darn Punk was partially made as a showcase for its soundtrack which included new music by such bands as Rancid, Guttermouth, Lagwagon, Swingin' Utters, Pennywise, The Ataris, and Ozma.

Directors: Jeff Richardson
Format: Color, NTSC
Language: English
Region: All Regions
Aspect Ratio: 1.33:1
Number of discs: 1
Run Time: 90 minutes

name: "JUDGE" Limited Edition Silk Screened Poster by Shepard Fairey (Signed by Joe Escalante)
description:
VERY LIMITED EDITION!

2012 was the year Joe Escalante (bassist for The Vandals and one of the founders of Kung Fu Records) ran to become a judge of Los Angeles County. Sadly, "the man" succeeded in keeping a punk rocker from taking the bench..but we have a very limited number of these incredibly rare posters left!

This Extremely limited original silk screened poster was created by the legendary Shepard Fairey (of OBEY & Obama fame) and is signed by Joe Escalante. Each is signed and numbered by the candidate. 

100% of the proceeds from these posters go to charities specifically chosen by Shepard and Joe. 

ESCALANTE FOR JUDGE (Limited Signed Edition) 
Artist: Shepard Fairey 
Year: 2012 
Medium:. Screen Print 
Size: 18" x 24" 
Signed by Joe Escalante

options.name: Limited Edition signed by Joe Escalante

name: "JUDGE" Limited Edition Silk Screened Poster (Signed by Shepard Fairey & Joe Escalante)
description:
VERY LIMITED EDITION!  

2012 was the year Joe Escalante (bassist for The Vandals and one of the founders of Kung Fu Records) ran to become a judge of Los Angeles County.  Sadly, "the man" succeeded in keeping a punk rocker from taking the bench..but we have a very limited number of these incredibly rare posters left!

This Extremely limited original silk screened poster was created by the legendary Shepard Fairey (of OBEY & Obama fame) and is signed by Joe Escalante and Shepard Fairey.  Only 30 of these dual autographed posters exist. Each is signed and numbered by the candidate. 

100% of the proceeds from these posters go to charities specifically chosen by Shepard and Joe. 

ESCALANTE FOR JUDGE (Limited Signed Edition)
Artist: Shepard Fairey
Year: 2012
Medium:. Screen Print
Size: 18" x 24" 
Signed by Shepard Fairey and Joe Escalante

options.name: Limited Edition Signed by both Shepard Fairey & Joe Escalante

name: The Vandals: Pixel Tee
description:
Ahhh...1981...

Ronald Reagan was President. The Titanic was finally found on the ocean floor of the North Atlantic. Lady Diana Spencer marries Charles, Prince of Wales.  The first American test-tube baby is born.  Speaking of which...so were The Vandals.  Maybe you were there, maybe you weren't....but look cool in this retro tee and make your friends feel like....totally lame.

Designed by artist Dominic Davi who was alive then, but wasn't old enough to do anything cool.

name: The Vandals: Chopsticks GREY Tee
description:
Who doesn't love Chopsticks?!?  When you wear this shirt, you are saying not only am I open to other foods and cultures, but my hands are extremely agile.....and oh yeah...I love The Vandals too.

Chopsticks Tee is orange ink on a grey shirt

name: The Vandals: Punk Rock Nutcracker Tee
description:
Ah...Christmas time. 

Say Oi to the punks, and Oi to the skins (yeah...we went there) with this ode to a punk rock Christmas. The official shirt of The Vandals Christmas Formal, you'll never need a Christmas sweater again.

Designed by artist Dominic Davi, who came far to close to getting carried away with this concept.

name: The Vandals: One Color Cloth Patch
description: Measure 4" X 4" and it's awesome.
